1.title: The Estate of Tammy Wynette

episode of.title: The Will: Family Secrets Revealed (TV Series 2010– )

1.plot: In 1998, singer Tammy Wynette dies at 55 leaving four daughters, her fifth husband, and two large life insurance policies. When her daughters get cut out, they question the events of their mother's death. The scandal rocks the country music industry.

2.title: The Estate of Ritchie Valens

episode of.title: The Will: Family Secrets Revealed (TV Series 2010– )

2.plot: February 3, 1959, Ritchie Valens, singer of Â"La Bamba,Â" dies in a tragic plane crash at the age of 17, leaving behind little more than his song writing credits. His death triggers a three-decade long battle to secure his legacy.

3.title: The Estate of Ted Williams

episode of.title: The Will: Family Secrets Revealed (TV Series 2010– )

3.plot: Catherine Dupree, the long lost daughter of country singer Hanks Williams discovers that she is the inheritor of his estate and music royalties. Dupree engages in a strenuous legal battle for what is rightfully her own in the Alabama Supreme Court.

4.title: The Estate of Andy Warhol

episode of.title: The Will: Family Secrets Revealed (TV Series 2010– )

4.plot: In 1987, Andy Warhol, the legendary artist, dies in a New York Hospital from complications after a routine operation. His death sets off a race to grab his millions and a fierce battle over the value of art that threatens his legacy as a cultural icon.

5.title: The Estate of Etta James

episode of.title: The Will: Family Secrets Revealed (TV Series 2010– )

5.plot: James Brown, the Godfather of Soul, dies in 2006. He leaves much of his estate to a trust for underprivileged children, while his family is left out in the cold. Was this Brown's decision, or was he influenced by trustees who are set to inherit the rest?

6.title: The Estate of LaTanya Haggerty

episode of.title: The Will: Family Secrets Revealed (TV Series 2010– )

6.plot: In 1999, LaTanya Haggerty, an unharmed woman with no criminal record, is shot dead by the police. The family is given an 18 million dollar payment by the City of Chicago. When LaTanya's half-sister is cut from the deal, a dramatic legal battle begins.

7.title: The Estate of Robert Johnson

episode of.title: The Will: Family Secrets Revealed (TV Series 2010– )

7.plot: In 1938, future legendary blues artist Robert Johnson dies penniless. A re-release of his recordings make him one of the top-selling blues artists of all-time. With no will or known descendants, the search for the heir to Robert Johnson's millions begins.

8.title: The Estate of Stieg Larsson

episode of.title: The Will: Family Secrets Revealed (TV Series 2010– )

8.plot: Writer Stieg Larsson dies in 2004 with an invalid will. His estate goes to his brother and father while his life partner gets nothing. The dispute over the estate gets more complicated when Larsson's novel, The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo, becomes a hit.

9.title: The Estate of Norman Otto Hipel

episode of.title: The Will: Family Secrets Revealed (TV Series 2010– )

9.plot: The estate of Canadian politician Norman Otto Hipel is investigated after his daughter claims she never received her share of the inheritance.

10.title: The Estate of John Kennedy Toole

episode of.title: The Will: Family Secrets Revealed (TV Series 2010– )

10.plot: In 1969, aspiring author John Kennedy Toole commits suicide. With no will, his parents are entitled to an estate that includes his unpublished manuscript, the future Pulitzer Prize-winning novel, A Confederacy of Dunces, along with a second manuscript.

12.title: The Estate of Jimi Hendrix

episode of.title: The Will: Family Secrets Revealed (TV Series 2010– )

12.plot: In 1970, guitar legend Jimi Hendrix dies without a will, making his father Al the sole inheritor. When Al dies, his other son Leon gets cut from his father's will. Instead, Al's adopted daughter is entrusted with carrying on the Hendrix legacy.

13.title: The Estate of Jerry Garcia

episode of.title: The Will: Family Secrets Revealed (TV Series 2010– )

13.plot: In 1995, Jerry Garcia, from the Grateful Dead, dies at 53. The rock legend leaves behind a family and a multi-million-dollar estate. Both Garcia's will and the IOU's he made spark lawsuits that land those closest to Garcia in and out of court for years.

14.title: The Estate of Gary Coleman

episode of.title: The Will: Family Secrets Revealed (TV Series 2010– )

14.plot: One-time child star Gary Coleman dies in 2010, and leaves behind a messy estate plan that pits his former spouse Shannon Price against best friend Anna Gray. The trial uncovers much dirt, and reveals that Coleman's relationships were not what they seemed.

1.title: The Estate of Joan Crawford

episode of.title: The Will: Family Secrets Revealed (TV Series 2010– )

1.plot: Actress Joan Crawford dies in 1977 and leaves nothing in her will for her two children Christina and Christopher. In addition to suing the estate, Christina surfaces a blasting recollection of her thoughts of her mother which ruins Crawford's reputation.

3.title: Estate of Wilbur Robinson

episode of.title: The Will: Family Secrets Revealed (TV Series 2010– )

3.plot: Wilbur Robinson dies at 75, and is only survived by two siblings Elneda and Joseph. The two should be entitled to his estate but it is missing! A quest for their money leads to many secrets being revealed including the discovery of their long lost brother

4.title: Estate of Mary Sheehan

episode of.title: The Will: Family Secrets Revealed (TV Series 2010– )

4.plot: Mary Sheehan's death in Savanna, Georgia in 1983 leads to a hunt for her rightful heirs. A rivalry between two Ireland based families soon develops as they both declare claims to Sheehan's riches. Corruption and conspiracy ensues to prove such claims.

6.title: The Estate of Joey Bishop

episode of.title: The Will: Family Secrets Revealed (TV Series 2010– )

6.plot: Joey Bishop of the famous 'Rat Pack', dies at 89, leaving behind assests worth seven million dollars. A battle for his money begins, as his housekeeper, Nora, sues Joey's lawyers, claiming she was his mistress, but is this enough to inherit his estate?

7.title: The Estate of Frederic C. Dumaine

episode of.title: The Will: Family Secrets Revealed (TV Series 2010– )

7.plot: Pierre Dumaine dies at 75. His children, Peter, Lael and Elizabeth, stand to inherit $150 million dollars. But, Elizabeth, born out of wedlock and given for adoption, fights to be acknowledged, as her share of the wealth rests in the hands of a judge.

8.title: The Estate of Doris Duke

episode of.title: The Will: Family Secrets Revealed (TV Series 2010– )

8.plot: Doris Duke dies at the age of 81. Bernard Lafferty, an uneducated, alcoholic butler, is left with her estate worth 1.2 billion dollars. Duke's friend, Dr. Harry Demopolous, sets out prove Lafferty is unfit to oversee the money's distribution.

9.title: The Estate of Howard Hughes

episode of.title: The Will: Family Secrets Revealed (TV Series 2010– )

9.plot: Billionaire Howard Hughes dies, leaving behind an estate worth $2.5 billion, but no will. But 3 weeks later, a will appears, leaving $156 million to Melvin Dummar. An epic legal battle will ensue to prove whether the will is genuine or counterfeit.

10.title: The Estate of Frankie Lymon

episode of.title: The Will: Family Secrets Revealed (TV Series 2010– )

10.plot: Frankie Lymon, singer of "Why Do Fools Fall in Love" dies from a drug overdoes at 25. Who will inherit the royalties from this hit song? His bandmates Herman Santiago and Jimmy Merchant? Or, Morris Levy, allegedly credited with co-writing the song?

1.title: The Estate of Conway Twitty

episode of.title: The Will: Family Secrets Revealed (TV Series 2010– )

1.plot: At the age of 59, famed country star Conway Twitty dies, leaving a $15-million estate to his four children. But Conway's widow is legally entitled to one-third of the estate. Fighting for her share, an ugly legal battle unfolds in the family.

2.title: The Estate of Art Hadley

episode of.title: The Will: Family Secrets Revealed (TV Series 2010– )

2.plot: Sarah Hadley, daughter of Art Hadley, the inventor of the expansion bracelet, dies at the age of 75. Her death triggers the distribution of a $7-million trust, but relatives from near and far feud as to who should really take home the money home.

3.title: The Estate of Johnnie Taylor

episode of.title: The Will: Family Secrets Revealed (TV Series 2010– )

3.plot: Johnnie Taylor, R&B musician, dies at 66 leaving behind a million-dollar estate. His six children expect to split his estate, until three strangers claim they're Taylor's children as well. Challenging the news, a 2-year legal battle ensues.

4.title: The Estate of Lillian Booth

episode of.title: The Will: Family Secrets Revealed (TV Series 2010– )

4.plot: Philanthropist Lillian Garis Booth dies at 92, leaving $10-million to her nephew Robert Reldan, a convicted serial killer serving a life sentence. In an effort to stop the inheritance, the father of one of his victims wages an epic legal battle.

5.title: The Estate of Rock Hudson

episode of.title: The Will: Family Secrets Revealed (TV Series 2010– )

5.plot: Rock Hudson dies in 1985 with AIDS. His death sparks a bitter lawsuit by Marc Christian who claims Hudson knowingly exposed him to HIV. The trial leads to a landmark decision about a partner's duty to disclose a potentially deadly diagnosis.

7.title: The Estate of Wayne Perry

episode of.title: The Will: Family Secrets Revealed (TV Series 2010– )

7.plot: The death of renowned, 55-year-old Country songwriter Wayne Perry in Ohio on May 15, 2005, sparks a five-year legal battle between his four children and his faith-healing evangelical sister for an estate valued at over a million dollars.

episode of.title: The Will: Family Secrets Revealed (TV Series 2010– )
